sub_title: PhD Candidate Soil Chemistry & Biology at Wageningen University & Research
summary: My passion is fundamental soil science that has a high social relevance. In my research I enjoy combining knowledge fields (soil chemistry, soil biology and some social science), working inter-culturally (from the Netherlands to Latin America, specifically Colombia), and connecting different academic groups (Wageningen UR and CIAT).

projects: [{'title': 'Writing for Society', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Writing is one of the most important ways of communicating. Students and researchers at university are trained in writing scientific papers for colleagues in their field of research, but usually not in writing for a broader audience. [{'company': {'id': 166859, 'name': 'Wageningen University & Research', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQFQJQXtOy2Stw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519889640020?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=DfM4gdRk76TMhZBoa5gWFhnkNZBuUm47LktavPNU9gg', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/wageningenuniversity/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Wageningen University & Research', 'description': 'New European Union food safety regulations for cacao render 50% of beans from Latin-American countries unsuitable for single-origin chocolate because of excessive cadmium levels. This threatens farmer livelihood and peace in the region. Ideally, the cadmium remains in the soil, such that it is not taken up by plants. To do that, soil amendments can be added like compost and lime. However, to apply these amendments we need to understand the chemical and biological mechanisms in the soil-root interface that determine how much cadmium is taken up. This knowledge will be created, aiding the design of effective soil amendments.

My project will be carried out at Wageningen University & Research, at the Soil Chemistry and Soil Biology chair groups. Experiments and fieldwork will be carried out in Colombia, in collaboration with the International Center for Tropical Agriculture (CIAT). I am connecting my work to the EU-funded Clima-LoCa project (see link) for logistical and intellectual support, as well as to make my work meaningful for cacao farmers in Latin America and the Caribbean.', 'title': 'PhD Candidate Soil Chemistry & Biology', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 166859, 'name': 'Wageningen University & Research', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQFQJQXtOy2Stw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519889640020?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=DfM4gdRk76TMhZBoa5gWFhnkNZBuUm47LktavPNU9gg', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/wageningenuniversity/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'Wageningen University & Research', 'description': 'Coaching students in writing their academic assignments (e.g. thesis, essays).
